title.narrative: ENHANCED AND FUNCTIONAL GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: Enhanced costing of models (includnig opportunity costs) established, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Human Rights Institutions, Immunization, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017 , there is a government-endorsed roadmap for the overall changes required to reform health and social protection systems necessary to realize the rights of the most vulnerable children, adolescents, women and families.

participating-org.narrative: EASTERN CENTER FOR INTEGRATED REHABILITATION FOR PEOPLE WITH DISA

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Integrated Office 1 Klovskiy Uzviz 01021 Kiev

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced costing of models (includnig opportunity costs) established

description.narrative: UNICEF significantly contributed to strengthening the capacity of the Government at central, regional and local level to establish and manage child-centered services, particularly within the framework of decentralization reform. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Updated CRC report available

actual.value: 2016:Reporting year on CRC for Ukraine is 2018. Government entity for report drafting will be identified in 2017. In 2016 upon request for support from MoSP UNICEF made rapid analysis level completion of NPA on CRC implementation till 2016. Main findings were presented to key line ministries and local

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of advocacy and engagement to place child poverty as a national priority

actual.value: 2016:With close cooperation between UNICEF and MoSP the National plan of action for 2016-2017 years on implementation of poverty reduction strategy in Ukraine was approved by Cabinet of Ministry. Thanks to UNICEF technical support new NPA included list of activities, with indicators of it implementation

title.narrative: Case Management existing as a system in the country

actual.value: 2016:Case management instruction drafted and submitted to the Government. 150 child protection specialists are trained on case management and child protection in emergency responses in TOT and training modules submitted to Ministry of Social Policy for integration into in-service training.Universal stru

title.narrative: Existence of disaggregated data on the most excluded

actual.value: 2016:MODA will be published in 2017. As a result of the national consultations, 5 priority areas of potential deprivations for children were identified: living conditions, especially housing and utilities, access to healthcare services, leisure and access to information, education and neighbourhood safet
